meanings.definition: To reduce (a dead body) to ashes by fire.
meanings.sent1: They cremated their beloved pet after it passed away.
meanings.sent2: The funeral home cremated the deceased according to their wishes.
meanings.sent3: The firefighter jokingly said he could cremate a marshmallow over the campfire.
meanings.sent4: The intense heat of the sun seemed to cremate everything in its path.
meanings.sent5: The volcanic eruption was so powerful that it cremated entire villages.

meanings.sent1: The old documents were cremated in the bonfire.
meanings.sent2: The arsonist attempted to cremate the evidence of the crime.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally cremated the toast in the toaster.
meanings.sent4: The wildfire threatened to cremate the entire forest.
meanings.sent5: The dragon's fiery breath could cremate anything in its path.
